definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
Pride and prejudice, novel by Jane Austen 珍·奧斯汀|珍·奥斯汀

sentences.english: Both of you have to discard prejudices before reaching agreement.
sentences.chinese: 你们双方只有放弃偏见才能达成一致。

sentences.english: Bias affects the overshoot or undershoot of the motion through the keyframe.
sentences.chinese: 偏见影响过头或欠该议案通过关键帧。

sentences.english: Lisa out to explain to the qin guess, hope he put down the prejudice against the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 塔利莎出去向秦猜解释，希望他放下对阿展的偏见。

sentences.english: Studies of adults show what's known as a baby-face bias.
sentences.chinese: 研究成年人知道什么事娃娃脸偏见。

sentences.english: Want to Eradicate Injustice? Go Ahead - The Forward Mail To Everyone You Know …!
sentences.chinese: 你想要根除这些偏见和不公吗？

sentences.english: When people are feeling badly about themselves, they're more likely to show bias against people who are different.
sentences.chinese: 当人们自我感觉不好时，更有可能对其他人产生偏见。

sentences.english: The world should not be prejudiced and jealous.
sentences.chinese: 世界不应抱有偏见和嫉妒。

sentences.english: Most reports on us slashers are inaccurate and biased.
sentences.chinese: 关于我们这些腐女子的报道，大都不准确且带有偏见。

sentences.english: Pride and prejudice, money, matrimonial value orientation, marriage.
sentences.chinese: 傲慢与偏见，金钱，婚姻价值取向，婚姻观。

sentences.english: The "RZH"standard also has shortcoming , and contains prejudice of the formal logic school.
sentences.chinese: 标准也是有缺点的，并内含形式逻辑派的“偏见”。
他是位无偏见的观察者。

sentences.english: The publisher has brought out the latest Chinese version of Pride and Prejudice.
sentences.chinese: 出版商出版了最新的《傲慢与偏见》中译本。

sentences.english: Another prejudice is the belief that policy should move cautiously.
sentences.chinese: 另一个偏见就是认为制定政策应该小心谨慎。

sentences.english: My skeptical explanations were ridiculed as biased and uninformed.
sentences.chinese: 我所怀疑的解释被嘲笑为有偏见和无知。

sentences.english: I will be fair and impartial when recommending both rewards and punishment.
sentences.chinese: 在实行奖励与惩罚时我将保持公正不带偏见。

sentences.english: Try to influence the person who has prejudice about you or the person who ever bluffed you.
sentences.chinese: 适当的去感化对你有偏见的人，抑或是欺骗过你的人。

definition: to reject/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to repel
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
way of looking at a thing/view/opinion/CL:個|个[ge4]
